sen.j: 徳源院（とくげんいん）は、滋賀県米原市にある京極氏の菩提寺。
sen.e: Tokugen-in Temple is the family temple of Kyogoku clan that exists in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.
Tokugen-in Temple is the family temple of the Kyogoku clan in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を追加、一部削除しました。
sen.e: Tokugen-in Temple is the family temple of the Kyogoku clan in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 清滝寺（きよたきでら）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Kiyotaki-dera Temple.
It is also called Kiyotaki-dera Temple.
It is also called Kiyotaki-dera Temple.

sen.j: 山号を霊通山と称する。
sen.e: Its sango ((literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple) is Reitsuzan.
The sango (literally "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Reitsuzan.
sen.cmt: 二重括弧だったため書替えました。
sen.e: The sango (literally "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Reitsuzan.

sen.j: 宗派は天台宗。
sen.e: The temple belongs to the Tendai sect.
The temple belongs to the Tendai sect.
The temple belongs to the Tendai sect.

sen.j: 1283年（弘安6年）、京極氏の初代京極氏信は近江守へと任ぜられ、1286年（弘安9年）に清滝寺を創建した。
sen.e: In 1283, Ujinobu KYOGOKU, the first generation of Kyogoku clan, was appointed Omi no kami (Governor of Omi Province), and he established Kiyotaki-dera Temple.
In 1283, Ujinobu KYOGOKU, the first generation of the Kyogoku clan, was appointed Omi no kami (Governor of Omi Province), and he established Kiyotaki-dera Temple in 1286.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞と訳漏れを追記しました。
sen.e: In 1283, Ujinobu KYOGOKU, the first generation of the Kyogoku clan, was appointed Omi no kami (Governor of Omi Province), and he established Kiyotaki-dera Temple in 1286.

sen.j: 1672年（寛文12年）、京極高豊は、幕府に請願し播磨国の所領2村と近江国を交換した。
sen.e: In 1672, Takatoyo KYOGOKU petitioned the bakufu for the exchange of two villages in Harima of his territory with Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1672, Takatoyo KYOGOKU petitioned the bakufu for the exchange of two villages in Harima Province of his territory with Omi Province.
In 1672, Takatoyo KYOGOKU petitioned the bakufu for the exchange of two villages in Harima Province of his territory with Omi Province.

sen.j: 同地にあり京極氏の菩提寺であった近江国清滝寺を復興。
sen.e: He re-established Kiyotaki-dera Temple, which was his family temple, in Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He re-established Kiyotaki-dera Temple, which was his family temple, in Omi Province.
He re-established Kiyotaki-dera Temple, which was his family temple, in Omi Province.

sen.j: 付近に散在していた墓碑を一カ所に集めて整理し三重塔を寄進した。
sen.e: He gathered gravestones scattered around the area, putting them in order, and donated a three-storied pagoda to the temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He gathered gravestones scattered around the area, put them in order, and donated a three-storied pagoda to the temple.
sen.cmt: 動詞の時制を統一しました。
sen.e: He gathered gravestones scattered around the area, put them in order, and donated a three-storied pagoda to the temple.

sen.j: 歴代当主の墓を集めて並べ、院号を父の法名に基づき徳源院と改めた。
sen.e: Also he gathered the gravestones of his successive family heads, putting them in line, and he changed ingo (name of temple's title) into Tokugen-in Temple after his father's homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has died or has entered the priesthood).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also he gathered the gravestones of his successive family heads, put them in line, and changed the ingo (name of temple's title) into Tokugen-in Temple after his father's homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has died or has entered the priesthood).
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を追加、時制を統一しました。
sen.e: Also he gathered the gravestones of his successive family heads, put them in line, and changed the ingo (name of temple's title) into Tokugen-in Temple after his father's homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has died or has entered the priesthood).

sen.j: この三重塔は現在、滋賀県の指定文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: The three-storied pagoda has been designated a cultural property of Shiga Prefecture.
This three-storied pagoda has been designated a cultural property of Shiga Prefecture.
This three-storied pagoda has been designated a cultural property of Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 弘安9年(1286年) 京極氏の初代京極氏信が建立
sen.e: In 1286, the temple was established by Ujinobu KYOGOKU, the first generation of Kyogoku clan.
In 1286, the temple was established by Ujinobu KYOGOKU, the first generation of Kyogoku clan.
In 1286, the temple was established by Ujinobu KYOGOKU, the first generation of Kyogoku clan.

sen.j: 寛文12年(1672年) 京極高豊が三重塔を建立
sen.e: In 1672, Takatoyo KYOGOKU established the three-storied pagoda.
In 1672, Takatoyo KYOGOKU established the three-storied pagoda.
In 1672, Takatoyo KYOGOKU established the three-storied pagoda.

sen.e: Ihaido (hall of the Buddhist memorial tablet)

sen.e: The graveyard of the Kyogoku family

sen.j: 京極家歴代の宝篋印塔が並んでいる。
sen.e: Hokyoin-to pagoda of the successive heads of Kyogoku family stands in line.
The successive Hokyoin-to pagoda (Japanese variants of stupas) of the Kyogoku family are arranged in line.
sen.cmt: 「宝篋印塔」の説明を追加、動詞を変更しました。
sen.e: The successive Hokyoin-to pagoda (Japanese variants of stupas) of the Kyogoku family are arranged in line.

sen.j: 道誉桜
sen.e: Doyo-zakura (Doyo Cherry Blossom)
Doyo-zakura (Doyo Cherry Blossom)
Doyo-zakura (Doyo Cherry Blossom)

sen.j: 婆沙羅大名として知られる佐々木道誉が愛したと伝えられるしだれ桜。
sen.e: The shidare zakura (weeping cherry) that has been said that Doyo SASAKI known as Basara daimyo loved.
The shidare zakura (weeping cherry) that is said to be loved by Doyo SASAKI known as Basara daimyo

sen.e: The shidare zakura (weeping cherry) that is said to be loved by Doyo SASAKI known as Basara daimyo
